intro: Hedyosmum crenatum, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with wavy edges. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Hedyosmum crenatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value but can become invasive in certain regions.
